name: ax-2
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2
body: |- wi(wi(w0, wi(w1, w2)), wi(wi(w0, w1), wi(w0, w2)))
comment: Axiom _Frege_. Axiom A2 of [Margaris] p. 49. One of the 3 axioms of propositional calculus. It "distributes" an antecedent over two consequents. This axiom was part of Frege's original system and is known as _Frege_ in the literature; see Proposition 2 of [Frege1879] p. 26. It is also proved as Theorem *2.77 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 108. The other direction of this axiom also turns out to be true, as demonstrated by ~ pm5.41 . (Contributed by NM, 30-Sep-1992.)
